phrase.item: I am Ranjit Kumar Singha.
I am a Bishnupriya Manipuri from Bangladesh.
I will now recite a [Bishnupriya] Manipuri poem.
My poem's name is Invitations.
Come here all children
We will row the boat on the highland lake.
The smile of the waves floats
There is no crying
There's a pocket full of games
and a pot filled with song
Come here and look around
at this fair of dreams.
No shouting or reprimanding at all
here with us.
Ripe fruits from trees and vines
plenty everywhere.
Here the winds are beating drums
In the light there is dance.
For you, an open sky (or the sky in an open field)
is just waiting.
Here there is no darkness anywhere.
no need to fear at all.
Mischief is in every corner
Correctness nowhere to be found / Search not for correctness (?)
Some people are wearing horns, some are out of their senses,
all are crazy.
There are no elders to scold you,
Everyone is younger than you.
Swim in happiness
Ride the mind's horse
We are free in our land
to move in the opposite direction.
O King Soralel (Rain God and King of Gods), our land is cracked and dry.
In the land of Moirang, Khoinu was expelled.
O King Soralel, our land is cracked and dry.
The soil of Khumol has dried up; give us rain, King of Gods.
Tree roots have come out of the ground; give us rain, King of Gods.
‎‎O King Soralel, our land is cracked and dry.
I my hair in a tight bun, put marigolds in it, and dance.
I tie my hair in a tight bun; Moirang has hidden behind the steep bank.
Why have I brought this bee nest with no honey from the Hirili marsh?
The big marsh is filled with white slaked lime; still they have placed a fish trap in the canal.
Give us rain, King of Gods; Give us rain, King of Gods.
In the dark night rain, how did I not bring my bamboo hat?
Forgetting my brother gave me a bamboo hat, I left it at home and came outside.
The taro leaf cannot absorb the crystal gold water drops.
Deina gave the bow that does not break when broken.
O King Soralel, our is cracked and dry.
The Bekuri tree in the yard does not grow fruit.
O King Soralel, our land is cracked and dry.
Give us rain, King of Gods. Give us rain, King of Gods.
Seven hills surround
Golden Manipur
In their midst, on the bank of Loktak,
lies Bishnupur.
Evidence/the trace remains there today
of the memories of mother.
The changing times
cannot erase our remembered history.
Seven hills surround
Golden Manipur.
In the battlefield where Babhru killed Arjun,
he brought a jewel from the netherworld
and revived him there.
Seven hills surround
Golden Manipur.
In their midst, on the bank of Loktak
lies Bishnupur.
The pleasure ground of Khamba and Thoibi
seeing it does not dissipate the heart's thirst.
The endless waves of Loktak
have been kept with care till today.
Seven hills surround
Golden Manipur.
In their midst, on the bank of Loktak,
lies Bishnupur.
Seven hills surround
Golden Manipur
Golden Manipur
Golden Manipur
Ladies and gentlemen / Greetings.
In our Bishnupriya Manipuri society, when we arrange a Raas-Leela or any cultural event like kirtan, we often present the story of Radha and Krishna's love and the story of their love-in-separation.
So whether it's at homes or at larger gatherings, at any event particularly dedicated to Radha-Krishna, this Radha-Krishna song is often presented.
Our highly respected vocalists also perform this song, so today, I will make an attempt.
The way our great, respected singers present their songs in India and Bangladesh, and the songs they present, that's what I will try to do.
Here, Radha is unable to meet with Krishna.
She expresses her sorrow in this song
Listen dear friends. I tell you, I might die with my wish unfulfilled.
‎‎Listen dear friends. I tell you, I might die with my wish unfulfilled.
My wish was not fulfilled; I am not here or there.
My wish was not fulfilled; I am not here or there.
Stuck in between, I wasted Radha's life.
I might die with my wish unfulfilled.
Listen dear friends. I tell you, I might die with my wish unfulfilled.
All of you, please do this: do not tell him about Radha's sorrow.
All of you, please do this: do not tell him about Radha's sorrow.
If Shri Govinda comes, please serve and take care of him.
If Shri Govinda comes, please serve and take care of him.
Do not tell him about Radha's sorrow.
Do not tell him about Radha's sorrow.
I might die with my wish unfulfilled.
Listen dear friends. I tell you, I might die with my wish unfulfilled.
‎‎Listen dear friends
Hunamanu (Golden Man)'s elder brother is Hunamanu Singh (Sensible Golden Man).
Come and I'll give you a proper slap on the ear.
Why do both of your eyes look like hockey balls?
And where is your crooked nose getting ready to go / veering off to?
There's no rhyme or reason to your face.
Come a little closer; I will paint your face black and white.
Don't come in front of me with such ugliness.
I say it with love: fix your face!

interlinear-text.item: 19-05-21 Event 7 - 'The Old Couple & Clever Fox' Story

phrase.item: Once upon a time (lit: There was and there wasn't.)
There was an old couple in a land.
They went to plant taro.
Then, a fox seeing it says
"Oh grandma, what are you doing?:
-- "We are planting taro, dear."
"Oh, not like that, not like that.
Let me give you some advice."
"If you listen to my advice, by tomorrow,"
"your taro potato will grow and you can cook a curry."
--"Oh, that would be good, dear. Teach me what to do."
"Okay.
One taro paotato, one ball of rice, one dry fish, and a little bit of water."
--"Oh, we do not have those with us, dear."
--"Let us go home and bring them."
Having said this, they went home to gather rice, dry fish, and water, and brought them back.
After bringing them, they planted according to the fox's advice:
one taro potato, once ball of rice, one dry fish, and some water.
After planting, when night came, they went home and slept.
At that time the fox came, pulled out all the taro potatoes, and took them.
After that, he ate and relished all those rice balls with dry fish.
He went to the jungle, picked various types of poisonous taro plants, and planted and left them.
The old couple woke up the next morning and saw that their taro plants had grown overnight.
Overjoyed, they picked the taro plants and had a curry they made using the potatoes.
After eating the curry, the old man starting itching so severely he was close to dying.
Then the old woman understood what happened.
That little fox tricked us!"
Saying this, she was angry. She charred a dry fish and gave it to the old man to ease the itching.
Then, they made a plan, --"We have to teach a lesson to this fox."
She said, "Old man, you lie down and pretend to be dead, then I will cry loudly.
That will bring the fox here."
--"If the fox comes, we will beat him."
As she said this, the old man layed down on the ground.
Then, the old woman started to wail:
-- "Our grandpa has died... He has nobody to cry for him."
As she was crying, the fox came and asked, "Oh grandma, grandma, what happened? What happened?
--"Oh yes my child, your grandpa has died."
"My gosh!
"What are you saying?
"How did he die so suddenly?"
After that the fox hugged the old man and started to cry:
--"Our grandpa has died, he has no one to cry for him," he said.
That time, suddenly the old woman got a stick and started to beat the fox.
Then the fox said, "Please don't beat me. I'm going to die. I will not repeat the same mistake again.
"Please pardon me. I will not repeat the same mistake again."
With that, the fox quickly left the area.
O King Soralel (Rain God and King of Gods), our land is cracked and dry.
In the land of Moirang, Khoinu was expelled.
O King Soralel, our land is cracked and dry.
The soil of Khumol has dried up; give us rain, King of Gods.
Tree roots have come out of the ground; give us rain, King of Gods.
‎‎O King Soralel, our land is cracked and dry.
I my hair in a tight bun, put marigolds in it, and dance.
I tie my hair in a tight bun; Moirang has hidden behind the steep bank.
Why have I brought this bee nest with no honey from the Hirili marsh?
The big marsh is filled with white slaked lime; still they have placed a fish trap in the canal.
Give us rain, King of Gods; Give us rain, King of Gods.
In the dark night rain, how did I not bring my bamboo hat?
Forgetting my brother gave me a bamboo hat, I left it at home and came outside.
The taro leaf cannot absorb the crystal gold water drops.
Deina gave the bow that does not break when broken.
O King Soralel, our is cracked and dry.
The Bekuri tree in the yard does not grow fruit.
O King Soralel, our land is cracked and dry.
Give us rain, King of Gods. Give us rain, King of Gods.
O, Heron Friend,
where are you going?
I am going to the lake.
Your children are on the river bank
crying 'wah wah' after eating chilies.
